biolockj.module.report.taxa

Class NormalizeTaxaTables

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.JavaModuleImpl
          • biolockj.module.report.taxa.TaxaCountModule
            • biolockj.module.report.taxa.NormalizeTaxaTables
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, JavaModule, ScriptModule, Comparable<BioModule>

    public class NormalizeTaxaTables
extends TaxaCountModule
implements JavaModule
    This utility is used to normalize and/or log-transform the raw OTU counts using the formulas:
    • Normalized OTU count formula = (RC/n)*((SUM(x))/N)+1
    • Relative abundance formula = Log(log_base) [ (RC/n)*((SUM(x))/N)+1 ]
    The code implementation supports (log_base = e) and (log_base = 10) which is configured via Constants.REPORT_LOG_BASE property.
    • RC = Sample OTU count read in from each Sample-OTU cell in the raw count file passed to the constructor
    • n = number of sequences in the sample, read in as the row sum (sum of OTU counts for the sample)
    • SUM(x) = total number of counts in the table, read in as the table sum (sum of OTU counts for all samples)
    • N = total number of samples, rowCount - 1 (header row)
    Further explanation regarding the normalization scheme, please read The ISME Journal 2013 paper by Dr. Anthony Fodor: "Stochastic changes over time and not founder effects drive cage effects in microbial community assembly in a mouse model" https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3806260/
    GUI Module Name
    Normalize Taxa Tables
